subject: Sleep
title: Sleep Deprivation Shrinks Learning
description: A fast breakdown of Sleep Deprivation Shrinks Learning for builders.

hook.text: One night of poor sleep reduces the brain's ability to learn new facts by up to 40 percent the next day.

buildup.text: The hippocampus needs sleep to clear yesterday's load. Without it, there's no room for today's input.

discovery.text: Brain scans show sleep-deprived learners have reduced hippocampal activation during encoding tasks.

twist.text: The deficit is not about attention or motivation. The hardware itself is impaired, even if you try harder.

climax.text: No amount of caffeine restores the learning capacity that a good night of sleep provides.

punchline.text: A tired brain can't store what it can't encode.

quiz.question: Why can't effort compensate for sleep-deprived learning?
options: The hippocampus itself is impaired, not just attention
